# Syllabus {background-iframe=".00_files/libs/colored-particles/index.html"}

## Main topics {.unnumbered .smaller}

1. R language basics
2. Introduction to Tidyverse: Data Wrangling & Tidying
3. Reproducible reports
4. Data Visualization
5. Webscraping
6. Advanced imports and data manipulations
7. Spatial analysis
8. Final Project

## Grading {.unnumbered}

| Category | Total points |
|----------|--------------|
| Weekly assignments | 70 (7 x 10 points) |
| Project (report + presentation) | 30 |
| Participation (extra) | 5 |
| **Total** | **105** |


## Weekly assignments

| Criteria | Points |
|----------|--------|
| Data Preparation | 2 |
| Visualization and graphics | 2 |
| Implementation | 2 |
| Report quality | 2 |
| Code quality and reproducibility | 2 |

## Project

| Criteria | Points |
|----------|--------|
| Data Preparation | 5 |
| Visualization and graphics | 10 |
| Implementation | 5 |
| Report quality | 5 |
| Code quality and reproducibility | 5 |

## Participation

Your presence at the class meetings and [active participation]{.hi} in the discussions will be appreciated.

## Five tips for success

1.	Complete all the preparation work before class.
2.	Ask questions.
3.	Do the readings.
4.	Do the Weekly assignments.
5.	Don't procrastinate.

## Academic honesty

<center>[TL;DR: Don‚Äôt cheat!]{.hi}<center>

- Collaboration
- Online resources
- Use of generative artificial intelligence (AI):
    + AI should not reduce your ability to think clearly
    + ‚úÖ AI tools as assistants
    + ‚ùå AI tools as decision-makers

## Late work

-20% of the maximum grade for each day after the deadline. No submissions accepted more than [3 days late]{.hi} without prior approval.
